intro: Psychotria womersleyi, commonly known as the Womersley's psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and clusters of small, white or pale green flowers. It often grows as an understory plant, thriving in humid, shaded environments. Psychotria womersleyi is also noted for its potential ethnobotanical uses, though further research is needed to confirm its properties.
